intro: Maximilianea angolensis, commonly known as the Angolan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
